metadata.query: What are the key features of Python 3.12?

data.title: Python 3.12: Cool New Features for You to Try
data.snippet: To look behind the curtain of the interpreter, you’ll use `dis`, which lets you disassemble your Python code and look at the bytecode instead:. Python 3.12 introduces a new syntax for type variables. You can learn more about the new syntax for type variables and see more practical examples in Python 3.12 Preview: Static Typing Improvements and PEP 695. They include more internal changes to the interpreter, a new typing feature, and new functions for grouping iterables and listing files. **Note:** There’s ongoing work on a new standard library module named `interpreters` that will expose subinterpreters to Python code. One of the new typing features in Python 3.12 is `@override`. In the new Python version, you have more support for working with weekdays and months. In Python 3.12, you can use the new `.walk()` method to work with files and directories. If you’re **maintaining a library** that needs to support older versions of Python, then you can’t use the new type variable syntax or the improvements to f-strings.

data.title: Python 3.12: A Comprehensive Overview of New Features ...
data.snippet: # Python 3.12: A Comprehensive Overview of New Features and Improvements. Significant syntax changes, interpreter functionality improvements, security enhancements, and various updates to the standard library mark this release. Python 3.12 introduces a new syntax for declaring generic classes and functions, making it more concise and explicit. PEP 688 introduces a way to use the buffer protocol from Python code. To improve robustness and prevent stack overflow issues, Python 3.12 introduces stack overflow protection on supported platforms. PEP 692 introduces a more precise way to type \*\*kwargs in function signatures using `TypedDict`. ## PEP 623: Remove wstr from Unicode Objects in Python’s C API. PEP 692 introduces a more precise way of typing `**kwargs` using `TypedDict`. This improvement enhances the expressiveness of type hints in Python. Python 3.12 introduces various language changes for improved consistency and functionality. Hire Python Developers who can take advantage of the enhanced type hinting capabilities, optimized comprehensions, improved error messages, and the many other additions to create more robust and efficient Python applications.

data.title: Python 3.12 – New Features and Improvements
data.snippet: Python 3.12 introduces major improvements including a refined type parameter syntax, enhanced error messages, and module enhancements.

data.title: Python 3.12: What's New
data.snippet: Python 3.12 introduces syntactic formalization of f-strings, which means that you can use the same type of quotes used in the beginning/end inside of the f-strings themselves. Like the last two versions of Python, Python 3.12 also brings better error messages. Improved `SyntaxError` error message when the user types import x from y instead of from y import x:. Also, check out the following resources if you're curious about the error message improvements to the previous two versions of Python:. 1. Python 3.10: Clearer Error Messages. 2. Python 3.11: Better Error Messages. Python 3.12 also brings some improvements to typing. Fortunately, Python 3.12 comes with support to type `kwargs` with different types by using `TypedDict`:. If a method is decorated with `@override`, Python type checkers will check if the method is actually overriding something. I'm sure you'll appreciate the syntactic formalization of f-strings, better error messages, and improved typing. I'm sure you're already looking forward to Python 3.13, which will bring Python-API support for per-interpreter GIL.

data.title: So, what is your favorite new feature in Python 3.12?

data.title: New Features You Need To Know In Python 3.12
data.snippet: The first thing that's improved in Python 3.12 is the error messages now over the last version updates of python already.
